private_information: My stack from top to bottom is A, B, C, D, E, F where A is smallest and F is largest.
left_peg.goal: Cooperate with the other agents to move all disks to the right peg preserving Hanoi rules.

middle_peg.goal: Cooperate with the other agents to move all disks to the right peg preserving Hanoi rules.

right_peg.goal: Cooperate with the other agents to move all disks to the right peg preserving Hanoi rules.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a final PDDL domain and problem encoding the Tower of Hanoi instance for the FastDownward solver so that the goal is all disks moved in order from left to right.

init.legal_move: Move one top disk at a time. Never place a larger disk on a smaller one.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 6 disks labeled A (smallest) through F (largest).
Initial configuration: left peg has disks from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F. Middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: right peg should have disks from top to bottom A, B, C, D, E, F and left and middle pegs should be empty.
Legal moves: move the top disk of any peg to the top of another peg, but never place a larger disk on top of a smaller one.

state_report.system_prompt: You are an agent representing the left peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. Provide an accurate description of your local state, the list of disks you hold from top to bottom, and the legal immediate moves available from your peg given the public rules. Do not emit PDDL.
state_report.prompt: You are left_peg. Use the public information in environment->public_information and your private information in agents->left_peg->private_information. Describe your local stack and enumerate the legal moves you can currently perform. Provide any constraints or assumptions you rely on.

state_report.system_prompt: You are an agent representing the middle peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. Provide an accurate description of your local state, the list of disks you hold from top to bottom, and the legal immediate moves available from your peg given the public rules. Do not emit PDDL.
state_report.prompt: You are middle_peg. Use the public information in environment->public_information and your private information in agents->middle_peg->private_information. Describe your local stack and enumerate the legal moves you can currently perform. Provide any constraints or assumptions you rely on.

state_report.system_prompt: You are an agent representing the right peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance. Provide an accurate description of your local state, the list of disks you hold from top to bottom, and the legal immediate moves available from your peg given the public rules. Do not emit PDDL.
state_report.prompt: You are right_peg. Use the public information in environment->public_information and your private information in agents->right_peg->private_information. Describe your local stack and enumerate the legal moves you can currently perform. Provide any constraints or assumptions you rely on.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert orchestrator that produces a complete PDDL domain and problem encoding for FastDownward. Integrate the local reports from peg agents, resolve naming or representation differences, and produce a single multi-agent-aware PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes the Tower of Hanoi instance. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Target the FastDownward solver and ensure the encoding respects single-disk moves and the constraint that a larger disk cannot be placed on a smaller disk. Keep actions that would correspond to moves distinct and clearly named.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You have the following public information in environment->public_information and the global goal in agents->orchestrator->goal. Here are the reports from the peg agents: left_report: {left_report} middle_report: {middle_report} right_report: {right_report} Integrate these reports and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownward solver that models the six-disk Tower of Hanoi instance with pegs left, middle, and right and disks A through F. Ensure initial and goal states match the environment specification and that the domain enforces legal moves and disk ordering. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>.
